intro: Phacelia novenmillensis, commonly known as the nine-millennial phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and open woodlands. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
